title: 'I am not joking': What Trump said on serving a 3rd term as US president
content: US President Donald Trump has mentioned the possibility of seeking a third term, suggesting that there are ways to bypass the two-term limit set by the US Constitution. Trump hinted at alternatives during a recent NBC News interview without providing specific details, raising the prospect of extending his presidency.

title: IPL 2025: MS Dhoni the finisher falls short
content: Sandeep Sharma successfully defended 20 runs in the final over against MS Dhoni, leading Rajasthan Royals to a six-run victory against Chennai Super Kings. Despite Dhoni’s efforts, Sharma's composed performance and a crucial catch by Shimron Hetmyer sealed the win, as CSK fell just short of Rajasthan Royals’ 182/9 total. With this thrilling victory, Rajasthan Royals gained crucial momentum and will now shift their focus to their next clash against Punjab Kings on Saturday.

title: J&K forces hunt ‘escaped’ terrorists after Kathua gunfight
content: Security forces in Jammu continued their operation in Kathua district's Sufain forest after a deadly gunfight with Pakistani terrorists. The confrontation resulted in the deaths of four policemen and two attackers. Authorities have urged vigilance as some terrorists may still be escaping through mountainous terrain.

title: DOGE term ending on ... : Elon musk reveals for the first time ever
content: Elon Musk, in an interview with Fox News, revealed his ambitious goal to slash $1 trillion from US government spending by May. Leading the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), Musk aims for a 15% reduction in federal spending without impacting critical services. Trump's administration has implemented stringent measures, highlighting the political challenges of such drastic fiscal reforms.

title: RR's Ghibli-inspired AI image for Hasaranga’s ‘Jhukega Nahi’ moment
content: Rajasthan Royals posted an AI-generated image of Wanindu Hasaranga celebrating after dismissing Vijay Shankar in an IPL 2024 match. The artwork, styled like a Studio Ghibli animation, mirrored the 'Jhukega Nahi' pose from the movie Pushpa. This highlighted the match where Rajasthan set a target of 183 for Chennai Super Kings, with Hasaranga's breakthrough as a key moment.

title: 'India’s DNA carries vaccine against ecological collapse': VP Dhankhar
content: India has practiced sustainability for centuries, integrating it into cultural and religious practices, stated Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar at the National Conference on Environment. He emphasized the need for optimal consumption and warned of the environmental risks of reckless resource exploitation, referencing India's historical environmental wisdom as a solution.

title: John Nash’s ‘Non-Cooperative Games’; a foundational work in 'Game Theory'
content: 'Instant Scholar' is a Times of India initiative to make academic research accessible to a wider audience. If you are a Ph.D. scholar and would like to publish a summary of your research in this section, please share a summary and authorisation to publish it. For submission, and any question on this initiative, write to us at instantscholar@timesgroup.com

title: Ghibli style image converter: Guide to turn your photos into an animation video
content: Social media is currently abuzz with Ghibli-style photo trends, featuring dreamy, pastel images. Utilizing AI tools and hand-drawn art, creators are now turning these into animation videos. This guide explains the step-by-step process to produce your own Ghibli-inspired short animation.

title: J&K assembly disallows Lone’s Article 370 resolution; Sajad slams reasons
content: Jammu and Kashmir's assembly disallowed People’s Conference chief Sajad Lone's resolutions on restoring Article 370 and returning detainees, citing law and order constraints. Lone criticized the rejection as a restriction on free expression and took a swipe at the National Conference's vague resolution for restoring special status. He emphasized the importance of expressing opinions and representing the people's will.

title: Trump’s tariff shock may boost Indian auto parts exports
content: The 25% tariff on auto parts and automobiles is unlikely to significantly impact India. While Indian auto part exports to the US total $2.2 billion, the uniform application of the tariff levels the playing field. The Indian government has an opportunity to boost exports amidst these tariffs.

title: 'Make a deal or ...': Trump's ultimatum after Iran rejects talks on N-programme
content: US President Trump has warned Iran of severe repercussions, including unprecedented bombings and economic pressure, if it fails to agree to a new nuclear deal. Amid escalating tensions and regional conflicts, Trump has set a two-month deadline for diplomatic success, highlighting serious geopolitical stakes.

title: How to create Ghibli style anime art using Google Gemini for free
content: Ghibli style art has surged on social media, with users turning personal photos into the beloved aesthetic of Hayao Miyazaki's films using Google Gemini's AI. The process involves uploading a photo, crafting detailed prompts, and refining the generated image. This trend blends cutting-edge technology with the whimsical charm of Studio Ghibli's dreamy visuals.

title: 'When I dropped the catch, KL Rahul said ... ': Abishek Porel
content: Young cricketer Abhishek Porel enjoys playing under the leadership of Axar Patel at Delhi Capitals. He appreciates KL Rahul's support, particularly after a missed catch, and values his guidance. Rahul's insights on pitch conditions were also helpful for Porel's successful innings in their IPL 2025 match. Having played alongside Axar Patel for the past two seasons, Porel has developed a better understanding of his leadership style.

title: 'Space is hard': Elon Musk weighs in after German rocket explodes
content: Elon Musk commented on Isar Aerospace's failed Spectrum rocket launch, stating that spaceflight challenges are significant. Germany's first private orbital launch attempt ended in a fiery crash after 30 seconds, but the mission gathered valuable flight data. Europe faces hurdles in achieving independent space access following geopolitical shifts.

title: Govt to convert Vodafone Idea's Rs 36,950 crore spectrum dues into equity
content: The government is set to increase its stake in Vodafone Idea to 48.99% by acquiring shares worth Rs 36,950 crore in exchange for spectrum auction dues. This move, following a relief package introduced in 2022, aims to alleviate Vodafone Idea's financial distress and address the company's significant debts and AGR obligations.

title: 'Mumbai Indians haven't been performing at that level': KKR's head coach
content: KKR head coach Chandrakant Pandit is confident ahead of their IPL 2025 match against MI, acknowledging Mumbai’s strong bowling despite Bumrah’s absence. He praised Rahane’s leadership and de Kock’s performance, and confirmed Narine's recovery, promising a thrilling contest at Wankhede.

title: Chaitra Navaratra commences at Shri Vaishno Devi Shrine, thousands throng to seek blessings
content: Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board launched new facilities on the first day of Chaitra Navaratra to enhance the pilgrimage experience. Improvements include smart lockers, free public call booths, and complimentary slots for disabled devotees, along with captivating Bhajan performances and special services like helicopter bookings.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Fitr 2025: Hindi Shayari, Wishes, Messages, Quotes, and Poems
content: Eid is a significant celebration for Muslims worldwide, marking the end of the holy month of Ramadan. The article provides wishes, messages, and poems for Eid al-Fitr 2023. It emphasizes gratitude, charity, togetherness, and prayers, allowing families and friends to share their love and blessings.

title: Poonch Police attach property of suspect who crossed over to PoK
content: Poonch Police have attached the property of Manzoor Ahmed, who crossed over to Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in the 90s and is currently residing there. The district court ordered the attachment due to his suspicious activities and involvement in a 1993 FIR under the Egress and Internal Movement Control Ordinance.

title: Philadelphia Phillies vs Washington Nationals: Where and how to watch today’s match, venue, time and more
content: The Phillies and Nationals are set to clash on March 30, 2025, at Nationals Park in Washington D.C. Experts predict a 9-5 win for the Phillies. Key players include Kyle Schwarber and Bryce Harper for the Phillies, while the Nationals will showcase CJ Abrams and Josh Bell.

title: Rahul Dravid inspects Guwahati pitch in wheelchair
content: Rajasthan Royals head coach Rahul Dravid, despite being on a wheelchair due to a recent injury, remains dedicated to his team’s IPL 2025 campaign. Dravid continues to actively participate, inspecting pitches and motivating the team, who have yet to win a match in the ongoing tournament. Meanwhile, Chennai Super Kings skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad won the toss and opted to bowl against Rajasthan Royals.

title: MLB legend Kevin Smith explains controversial Torpedo bat design
content: The New York Yankees are off to a record-breaking start with three consecutive home runs in their opening game. Their new 'Torpedo' barrel bats, developed by an MIT physicist, enhance performance by increasing contact area, as explained by former third baseman Kevin Smith.

title: IPL: Starc wreaks havoc, Faf fires in DC's dominant win over SRH
content: Mitchell Starc's 5-35 paved the way for Delhi Capitals' seven-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad, who struggled despite Aniket Verma's 74. Faf du Plessis smashed a rapid fifty to lead the chase, ensuring DC remained unbeaten in IPL 2025. For SRH, uncapped batter Aniket Verma was the lone bright spot, producing a stunning 74 off 41 balls. He forged a crucial 77-run partnership off just 40 balls with Heinrich Klaasen (32), but the rest of the batting order failed to capitalize, once again struggling to put up a competitive total.

title: Twitter down: Elon Musk-owned X outage affects thousands globally
content: Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter) faced significant technical issues, with over 7,100 user complaints. Approximately 39% reported app access problems, and many encountered an error message. Previously this month, a DDoS attack by Dark Storm, a Pro-Palestinian group, caused intermittent outages, with reports peaking at 40,000 affected users. Musk indicated substantial coordinated cyberattacks were responsible.

title: 1 dead after 11 coaches of Bengaluru-Kamakhya Express derail in Odisha
content: At least 11 coaches of the Bangalore-Kamakhya AC Superfast Express derailed near Nergundi station in Cuttack district on Sunday. No injuries were reported. Senior railway officials and relief trains have been dispatched. A special train is being arranged for stranded passengers. The cause of the derailment is under investigation.

title: KKR handed massive Sunil Narine fitness update ahead of MI clash
content: Kolkata Knight Riders head coach Chandrakant Pandit confirms Sunil Narine’s return for the clash against Mumbai Indians after recovering from illness. Narine’s presence will enhance KKR's bowling attack and offers an additional batting option as they aim for their second consecutive win in the IPL season.

title: Aniket Verma: The SRH hitter who scored maiden IPL fifty
content: Aniket Verma's explosive 74 off 41 balls powered Sunrisers Hyderabad against Delhi Capitals, lifting them from 37/4 to a competitive total. His innings featured 4 fours and 6 sixes, with a strike rate of 180.49. Verma’s aggressive play against top bowlers like Mitchell Starc provided SRH hope in a challenging match, demonstrating his value to the team.

title: Wife of Patnaik's top aide takes VRS from IAS, fuels buzz of political plunge
content: Senior IAS officer Sujata Rout Karthikeyan has taken voluntary retirement, sparking rumors of her entry into politics. Sujata, who was serving in the finance department, dismissed these speculations, citing personal reasons for her resignation. Her departure follows her husband VK Pandian's earlier retirement and subsequent low-profile entry into the BJD.

title: 'Military pressure on Hamas working': Netanyahu pushes for Trump plan
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu asserts that military pressure is creating cracks in Hamas negotiations. Despite ongoing conflicts and rising casualties, Israel demands Hamas disarm and leave Gaza, aiming to implement the Trump plan, while international allies support the nation’s efforts.

title: 'Duty to ensure my movies ...': Mohanlal apologises amid 'Empuraan' row
content: Superstar Mohanlal has apologized for distress caused by political and social themes in his latest film L2: Empuraan. Following backlash, the production team decided to remove contentious elements, with changes suggested by the CBFC. Despite controversies, the film has achieved significant box office success.

title: Record! India's Gulveer sets new national high in 10,000m event
content: Indian athlete Gulveer Singh broke his own national record in the men's 10,000m event at the Ten 2025 athletics meet in San Juan Capistrano, USA, with a time of 27:00.22s. This new record is 14.66 seconds faster than his previous one, set in Japan in 2024.

title: Afspa extended across most of Manipur for six months
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA) in Manipur, Nagaland, and Arunachal Pradesh for six more months due to ongoing security concerns. The move aims to address insurgency and maintain order amid continued ethnic violence, particularly in Manipur since May 2023.

title: Carmelo Anthony and La La Anthony are always ready to support their son Kiyan
content: Kiyan Anthony shined as the star player for Lutheran High School during The Throne basketball tournament, leading his team to an 83-56 victory over the William J. Brennan Bears in the semifinals. His parents, Carmelo and La La Anthony, were present to cheer him on.

title: Fact check: Did Parthiv Patel say 'MI is missing captain Rohit Sharma'?
content: Misinformation troubles cricketers and analysts during IPL 2025, as evidenced by false statements attributed to former players. Parthiv Patel debunked a fake quote involving Rohit Sharma, and Aakash Chopra addressed edited commentary clips. These incidents underscore the persistent issue of fake news in sports media, forcing figures to continually refute misleading content.

title: Myanmar quake: Chinese firm under fire after Bangkok skyscraper collapse
content: A Chinese construction company is being investigated after a Bangkok skyscraper collapsed during a 7.7 magnitude earthquake that struck Myanmar, killing at least 17 people and trapping dozens. Engineers had previously raised concerns about the building's structural integrity, citing rapid construction and inadequate materials.

title: Gamecocks rally, make fifth straight Final Four
content: South Carolina, which trailed by six points in the third quarter, needed yet another comeback to keep its hopes of a repeat alive, rallying in the fourth quarter and holding on to defeat Duke 54-50 on Sunday and advance to its fifth straight Final Four.

title: Boone: Yankees' torpedo bats about being 'best'
content: The new torpedo bats drew attention when the Yankees hit a team-record nine homers, with manager Aaron Boone saying their usage is for "just trying to be the best we can be."

title: Sources: Aiyuk trade unlikely barring late change
content: The 49ers are not expected to trade wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk by Tuesday, when he is due a $22.85 million bonus, barring a late deal materializing, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Willard bolts Maryland to become Villanova coach
content: Kevin Willard, who led Maryland to the Sweet 16 of this season's NCAA tournament, has accepted Villanova's offer to become the program's head basketball coach.

title: Cowboys feel good about recent talks with Parsons
content: Cowboys executive vice president Stephen Jones feels "good" about the direction of talks between the team and All-Pro pass rusher Micah Parsons.

title: Ravens wait for NFL to finish Tucker investigation
content: Ravens president Sashi Brown said Sunday that the team won't make a determination on kicker Justin Tucker's future with the franchise until the NFL has finished its investigation.

title: Haaland injured as Man City reach FA Cup semis
content: Erling Haaland was substituted with a left ankle injury in the 60th minute of Manchester City's FA Cup quarterfinal match against Bournemouth on Sunday.

title: European soccer review: Barcelona extend unbeaten run to 20
content: Barcelona continue to cruise under manager Hansi Flick and towards the LaLiga title. That and more from around the continent in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: What this historic day of home runs says about Aaron Judge, Yankees
content: Judge's three homer game helped New York make long ball history and reminded us just how good the slugger is.

title: NHL playoff watch: Who will win the Atlantic Division crown?
content: The Panthers, Leafs and Lightning are locked in a battle. Plus, updated projections for the playoff bracket.

title: Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Messi scores 2 minutes into return in Miami win
content: Lionel Messi scored two minutes after coming off the substitutes' bench as Inter Miami beat the Philadelphia Union 2-1 at Chase Stadium on Saturday.

title: Trinity Rodman: Back likely never will be 100%
content: USWNT star Trinity Rodman has given a sober assessment of her ongoing back issues, saying she doesn't think it will ever be fully healthy again.

title: Mbappé: 'Very special' to match Ronaldo tally
content: Kylian Mbappé said matching Cristiano Ronaldo's goal tally in his debut Real Madrid season is "very special" after scoring twice in a 3-2 comeback win over Leganés on Saturday.

title: Guardiola: My performance has been 'really poor'
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has said his own efforts this season have been "really poor" as his side struggle to recapture their title-winning form.

title: Canada insists injured Davies got 'proper care'
content: The Canadian soccer federation defended its handling of star player Alphonso Davies after Bayern Munich threatened to take legal action in the aftermath of his serious injury suffered during the Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: Tudor gets unlikely assist in debut as Juve coach
content: New Juventus coach Igor Tudor had a direct role in the Bianconeri's first goal since he replaced the fired Thiago Motta.

title: Forest reach 1st FA Cup semifinal since 1991
content: Nottingham Forest secured a place in the FA Cup semi-finals by beating Brighton & Hove Albion 4-3 in a penalty shootout when Ryan Yates smashed home the winner after the game finished goalless following extra time.

title: Reports: Blitzer close to selling RSL, Utah Royals
content: Billionaire businessman David Blitzer is in advanced talks to sell a large stake in both Real Salt Lake of MLS and the Utah Royals of NWSL after owning both franchises since 2022, according to multiple reports.

title: Mayer and Price are the best welterweights; now they need to fight
content: After anther victory, the only thing between Mikaela Mayer and the undisputed championship is Lauren Price.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid plan shocking move for Fernandes
content: Will Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes replace Luka Modric in Real Madrid's midfield? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: KSINC drops plan to operate package tours from Marine Drive to Kakkathuruthu island
content: The agency cites a year-long delay by local bodies and Fisheries dept. in removing two unlicensed nets obstructing safe navigation along the waterway as the reason for not proceeding with its plan

title: Kochi’s port connectivity highway caught in delay over demand for alignment change
content: National Highways Authority of India has agreed to change of alignment, provided Cochin Port Authority hands over ₹100 crore as additional expense for the purposeose

title: Kerala Urban Policy moots public, private and people’s partnership in the future development of State
content: Kerala should develop a risk-informed master plan at the local level to integrate climate resilience into urban planning, says report

title: Third eye network expands in Kozhikode to keep an eye on drug peddlers
content: Vadakara municipality has installed 20 new cameras at key locations within its limits; efforts are also under way in the municipal limits of Koyilandy, Payyoli, Mukkom, and Ramanattukara to upgrade the existing CCTV network

title: MP flags different responses to same question in Parliament
content: MP had raised a question to Ministry of Science and Technology on which was the first State to implement a science policy after Independence

title: CBI catches BIS Joint Director accepting ₹70,000 bribe
content: A case has been registered against V. Lakshminarayana Reddy alias Babu Reddy, Y. S. Manohar and others for offering bribe to a public servant

title: We are pioneering a Telangana model for the Congress, says Deputy CM Bhatti
content: The model pioneered by the Congress will ensure economic growth and social inclusion go hand in hand, and will be an alternative to the BJP’s vision, says Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka Mallu.

title: Police Commission suggests law to stop protests that make use of dead bodies
content: The proposed ‘Tamil Nadu Honour of Dead Body Act’ aims at to curbing agitations with unjustified demands using dead bodies

title: A point to ponder while solving the Chennai airport conundrum
content: If Chennai has to regain lost traffic, this is the best solution: demolish the bridge across the river before the next floods. The old secondary runway was working well for smaller aircraft. Build the parallel runway and use it for smaller aircraft and wide-body aircraft

title: 'Did anyone die?' asks Lamborghini driver after hitting two pedestrians in Noida, arrested
content: A purported video surfaced online showing that after the accident, a man was heard asking the accused if he knew how many people died here. To this, the accused asked the locals "koi mar gaya idhar? (did anyone die here?)" and came out of the car

title: Ugadi Mahotsavams draw huge crowds at Srisailam
content: Panchanga Sravanam (almanac reading) was held as per tradition; Traditional artisans from Kerala, Mumbai, and Karnataka, as well as folk artists, performed during the Rathotsavam

title: 98.47% of local bodies in Kerala achieve waste-free status
content: As part of the Malinya Muktham Navakeralam campaign, the government had set March 30 as the deadline for attaining the status

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu launches  ‘P4’ initiative to eradicate poverty by 2029
content: The ambitious programme seeks to bridge the socio-economic divide by encouraging the wealthiest 10% of population to support the bottom 20% of the poorest families

title: PM Modi pitches for rainwater harvesting, waste recycling
content: Unprecedented tasks related to water conservation had been undertaken in many parts of the country, the PM said in his Mann Ki Baat address, highlighting recycling of waste for a sustainable future

title: Hold Indian Labour Conference to discuss issues of workforce, House panel tells govt
content: Maintaining that the last ILC (46th) was held in 2015, the panel says the reasons for not holding it during the last 10 years have not been shared

title: Aditya Nigam and Hilal Ahmad win Ramchandra Khan Social Science Award
content: The award selection committee said their books possessed ‘global intellectual quality, creative vision, and profound discourse’

title: Myanmar earthquake: Army team inducted at Mandalay, recce on to set up field hospital
content: Two more Indian Navy ships departed for Yangon from the Andaman and Nicobar Command in addition to the two ships dispatched from Visakhapatnam a day before

title: Volunteer rescue group saves beached whale sharks along Thiruvananthapuram city’s coastline
content: Their seasonal migration from the Arabian Sea to Australia’s western coast begins in January and concludes in March

title: Kamban is creator and father of ‘Bharatiya culture’: R.N. Ravi
content: Kamban’s literary genius transcended language and region, inspiring poets and saints across India to narrate the story of Sri Rama, says the Governor at the inauguration of seven-day Kamba Ramayanam festival at Kambarmedu in Mayiladuthurai district;

title: Forest dept. relies on tribal wisdom to tackle human-wildlife conflicts
content: Dept. is compiling information from the residents of over 300 tribal hamlets in the State as part of the Mission Tribal Knowledge. The tribal knowledge will be scientifically validated and tried out in areas of conflict shortly

title: Donald Trump ‘radar-focussed’ on reciprocity, anticipate tariffs on April 2, says Mark Linscott
content: Previous trade negotiator with India says lowering tariffs, balancing trade deficit, and agricultural market access key for a US-India deal

title: UoH unrest: Students protest as bulldozers move inside campus, police respond with force
content: Students’ Union of University of Hyderabad released a statement strongly condemning the police brutality and unlawful detention of students who were peacefully protesting against the illegal encroachment of university land

title: Condition of 23-year-old female intern is ‘very critical’, says health bulletin
content: She tries to end life after accusing KIMS Bollineni hospital’s AGM of sexual assault and criminal intimidation

title: Ex-HC judge to lead committee for new medical colleges approval
content: Andhra Pradesh government appoints Justice U. Durga Prasada Rao as HPC chairman to assess and recommend new medical, dental, and nursing colleges

title: SGOU headquarters: land registration completed
content: Along with an administrative block with an area of 6,000 square metres, entrance gate, compound wall, roads, landscaping, and greening will be carried out in the first phase

title: Haryana Police ban on songs promoting violence sparks controversy
content: About 10 songs have been taken down from various social media platforms over the past fortnight, and at least two concerts, including one in Gurugram, halted midway

title: Madrasa row: Crackdown and actions will continue on ‘illegal structures’ in days to come, says Pushkar Dhami
content: In a Statewide crackdown on Madrasas (Islamic schools), the Uttarakhand government has sealed over 136 such institutions so far.

title: Kodandarama rides Kalpavriksha, Sarvabhoopala Vahanams
content: Lord Kodandarama’s deity taken in Kalpavriksha and Sarvabhoopala Vahanam processions at TTD temple, draws large crowds

title: Cultural fervour marks Ugadi festivities in Tirupati
content: Following ‘Mangala Dhwani’, the playing of traditional instrumental music, Vedic hymns were chanted to signal the commencement of the events pertaining to the Telugu New Year at the Mahati Auditorium

title: Comprehensive action plan for child and youth welfare in Kerala: CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Primary objectives of mission include strengthening mental health support systems, preventing substance abuse and related mental health issues, and establishing a safe and secure social atmosphere

title: Fifty Maoists surrender in Bijapur; CM Vishnu Deo Sai hails State policy
content: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai credited the State government’s recently announced surrender-cum-rehabilitation policy for the surrenders

title: One foot in the past, one in the future
content: India accounts for about 26% of the global burden of tuberculosis cases and deaths. With 2025 being the year that TB was to be eradicated from the country, the government is now trying to find community-driven solutions to combat the disease. Bindu Shajan Perappadan reports from Meghalaya on how the area’s traditional healers form a bridge between the people and government, and are coopted into the fight against the disease

title: Watch: Defunct NJAC act | Why is it suddenly pushed for renewal?
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss the sudden push for renewal of the defunct NJAC act

title: President Murmu greets citizens on eve of Eid-ul-Fitr
content: President Droupadi Murmu said the festival also promotes social bonding and inspires us to build a harmonious, peaceful and prosperous society

title: Edamalaipattipudur UPHC in Tiruchi receives NQAS certification
content: A national-level team had assessed the quality of infrastructure and services offered to expectant mothers and new-borns; the UPHC scored an impressive 94.68% in assessment

title: Administrative sanction accorded for new police station building in Koyilandy
content: Kerala Police Housing Cooperative Society has been entrusted with the supervision of the construction work

title: Revised taxes and fees to kick in on April 1 in Kerala
content: Revenue mobilisation proposals for 2025-26 fiscal are designed to rake in an additional ₹366 crore for Kerala government

title: Telangana sizzles as mercury soars above 40°C across all 33 districts
content: According to data from the Telangana Development Planning Society (TGDPS), Ibrahimpatnam in Jagtial district reported the highest maximum temperature at 41.5°C

title: Those opposing Sangh’s work will join us one day, says Dattatreya Hosabale
content: In 100 years, the Sangh has travelled from neglect and ridicule to curiosity and acceptance, the RSS general secretary said on the centenary of the saffron organisation.

title: Grandeur marks Ugadi celebrations in Chittoor
content: Collector emphasises the importance of preserving traditions and respecting elders, while SP appeals to the parents to impart Telugu language skills to their children

title: During visit to Chhattisgarh, Modi blames Congress’ policies for Maoism
content: He was addressing a public meeting in Bilaspur after inaugurating and laying the foundation stone for development projects worth ₹33,700 crore in the State

title: Ambedkar Porata Samithi to hold protest in New Delhi on March 31 for implementation of Communal Award
content: Separate electorate system under Communal Award will ensure real benefit for SC and STs, says Samithi president

title: Kurnool administration to rope in SHGs to set up water kiosks in villages
content: Medical and health department officials instructed to make ORS packets, IV fluids, and necessary medicines available at all PHCs and CHCs

title: Family of four die by suicide in Madakasira town
content: Krishnamachari, 40 had reportedly run into huge debts after opening his own jewellery shop. Under immense pressure from the moneylenders, he is believed to have taken the extreme step

title: Telangana green activist gets first award named after Jadav Payeng
content: The award has been instituted by the eastern Assam-based charitable Jyoti-Protap Education Trust for environment and climate action

title: Odisha CM Majhi to launch 'Antyodaya Gruha Yojana' in Kalahandi district on March 30
content: Odisha CM to launch ₹7,550 crore housing scheme in Kalahandi district, benefiting 50,000 underprivileged citizens

title: Two tmc ft of water from Bhadra reservoir to be released to canals between April 1 and 5
content: As of Sunday (March 30, 2025), Bhadra has 28 tmc ft of live storage, with 11 tmc ft needed for irrigation till May 8 and 14 tmc ft for drinking water, leaving a cushion of 3 tmc ft

title: In poll-bound Bihar, Amit Shah urges people to press ‘lotus’ to ensure the return of NDA government
content: The Home Minister alleged that Lalu Prasad’s government created a new record of scams by doing tar scam, flood relief scam, railway hotel scam, soil scam, fodder scam and land for job scam

title: Security beefed up across Jharkhand in view of Eid, Ram Navami
content: “Special arrangements are being made for sensitive places such as Ranchi, Jamshedpur, Hazaribag and Giridih,” a senior official said

title: Third edition of AIAC hosts 21 artists from nine ASEAN countries
content: Over 10 days, artists will create original works, take part in workshops on classical dance, music, and handicrafts, and explore India’s artistic traditions in a collaborative setting

title: Maoist surrenders double in first quarter; CRPF intelligence gets active
content: CRPF intelligence unit persuades Maoists to surrender, reshaping CPI (Maoist) ideology towards mainstream, reducing Naxal violence significantly

title: Long stays in postings breed corruption, rotate officers: Parliament panel to govt
content: There has been a rotational policy for all officers but it is not being implemented in toto, the Department-related Parliamentary Standing Committee on Personnel, Public Grievances, Law and Justice said in its 145th report, tabled in Parliament

title: AFSPA extended in Manipur, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh for another six months
content: In Manipur, affected by ethnic violence, the AFSPA has been extended in the whole State, except for the jurisdiction of 13 police stations in five of the State’s valley districts

title: 6 killed after uprooted tree crushes vehicles in Himachal
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Watch: Rocket carrying European orbital vehicle crashes after launch
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. title: Reranking the women's Elite Eight: UConn is top dog
content: Paige Bueckers sets a new UConn NCAA Tournament record with 40 points to lead the Huskies past Oklahoma and into the Elite Eight . the 2025 women's tournament shifts to the elite eight . 103-34 vs. no. 15 Arkansas State (fokane 4) Tournament results .

title: IndiGo slapped with Rs 944 crore tax penalty; airline vows to challenge in court
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Follow live: Tennessee scrambling to catch Houston in Elite Eight matchup
content: The  Duke Blue Devils  and  Florida Gators  punched their tickets to the men's Final Four. Will fellow 1-seeds  Houston  or  Auburn  join them in San Antonio? Houston will have to survive the  Tennessee Volunteers  while Auburn will try to hold off Tom Izzo's  Michigan State Spartans  (5:05 p.m. ET) as the Elite Eight closes out in Indianapolis and Atlanta, respectively. We'll be tracking the action all afternoon, so follow along as we enter the final stretch of March Madness. Go to:  Relive Saturday night's action

title: New Mexico hires UC San Diego's Olen as coach
content: UC San Diego 's Eric Olen has hired him as the school's next head coach . he received a five-year contract, sources tell ESPN's Pete Thamel . "eric is a proven winner with an incredible track record," new Mexico athletic director says .

title: 'Very angry at Putin': Trump threatens Russia for delaying Ukraine truce deal

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs .

title: Will Bomb Iran If They Don't Sign Nuclear Deal, Says Trump
content: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened Iran with bombings and secondary tariffs on Sunday if Tehran did not come to an agreement with Washington over its nuclear program.

title: "No Ulterior Motive": Prashant Kishor Backs Kunal Kamra On "Gaddar" Row
content: Former election strategist and Jan Suraj Party chief Prashant Kishor today backed stand-up comic Kumal Kamra amid the huge controversy over his comments on Eknath Shinde, saying he does not play politics or have "ulterior motives".

title: Video: Tanker Loses Control, Drives Off Flyover, Spills Flammable Oil
content: Traffic movement was regular on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad Highway in Maharashtra's Palghar. But at 4:55 pm, a tanker filled with kerosene (a flammable oil) fell off the flyover and caught fire.

title: "Did Anyone Die?" Lamborghini Driver After Hitting 2 Workers On Footpath
content: A red Lamborghini struck two pedestrians on a footpath adjacent to an under-construction complex in Noida's Sector 94 this evening.

title: IIIT Allahabad Student Dies By Suicide In Hostel A Day Before Birthday
content: A first-year student of the Indian Institute of Information Technology (IIIT), Allahabad, allegedly died by suicide at the hostel campus on Saturday night, police said on Sunday.

title: Myanmar Earthquake Aftermath: Satellite Images Show Huge-Scale Destruction
content: The stench of decaying dead bodies permeated the air in Mandalay-- Myanmar's second-largest city-- on Sunday, two days after a massive earthquake killed at least 1,700 people and left countless others buried.

title: Live: Aftershocks Rattle Myanmar City As Rescuers Search For Survivors
content: Myanmar, Thailand, Bangkok Earthquake LIVE Updates: The number of deaths caused by a massive earthquake that hit Myanmar and Thailand rose in both countries on Sunday.

title: Centre To Convert Vodafone Idea Spectrum Dues Worth Rs 36,950 Crore Into Equity
content: Vodafone's spectrum auction dues worth Rs 36,950 crore will be converted into equity by the government, which will increase its holding in Vodafone Idea to 48.99 per cent - up from 22.6 per cent.

title: IPL 2025: Nitish Rana, Hasaranga Shine As RR Edge Past CSK By 6 Runs
content: Rajasthan Royals vs Chennai Super Kings Highlights, IPL 2025: After losing their first two games, RR finally tasted victory with 6-run win over CSK.

title: 500-Year-Old Telugu Rock Inscription Found In Telangana's Anantgiri
content: Telugu inscriptions dating back to 1517 CE have been found in parts of Telangana by the Archaeological Survey of India. The find comes months after a treasure trove of inscriptions and rock art was found in neighbouring Andhra Pradesh.

title: Sam Altman Says OpenAI Team "Needs Sleep" As Ghibli-Style AI Art Goes Viral
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has called for a pause as social media is overrun with AI-generated Studio Ghibli-style images.

title: Myanmar's Military Continues To Bomb Towns Amid Deadly Earthquake Crisis
content: An armed resistance movement against Myanmar's military-run government criticised the junta on Sunday for conducting airstrikes on villages even as the country reels from an earthquake that has killed around 1,700 people.

title: "Powerful Hands Behind...": Shock 'Cover Up' Claim Over Shane Warne Death
content: A report, quoting a police officer from the site of Shane Warne's death, has claimed that a controversial item was removed on the order of some senior people.

title: Woman Can't Be Forced To Take Virginity Test, Says High Court
content: The Chhattisgarh High Court has said that a woman cannot be forced to undergo a virginity test which violates Article 21 of the Constitution that guarantees her fundamental right to protection of life and liberty, including the right to dignity.

title: Why US Is Asking Hundreds Of International Students To Self-Deport
content: Hundreds of international students studying in the US have received emails from the US Department of State (DOS), telling them to self-deport as their F-1 visas (student visas) have been revoked owing to campus activism.

title: China Connection Emerges In Bangkok Skyscraper That Collapsed During Quake
content: A Chinese-backed construction firm is being investigated over the collapse of a 33-storey high-rise in Thailand's Bangkok during Friday's 7.7-magnitude earthquake that struck central Myanmar.

title: 'This Has Become Popular': ChatGPT Briefly Goes Down Amid Ghibli Art Trend
content: ChatGPT, the popular AI chatbot developed by OpenAI, was down for several users on Sunday with its servers overwhelmed by a surge in demand for its new Studio Ghibli-style image generation feature.
